conclusion: Analyze positions over time using v-t graphs to find when objects are farthest apart.
Object A moves with constant velocity; Object B slows down, reaches minimum velocity, then speeds up.
Position at any time is the integral of velocity from 0 to t, or area under v-t graph.
Separation is the difference in areas under the curves of A and B.
At t1, Object B reaches minimum velocity; at t2, velocities of A and B are equal.
From 0 to t1, Object A is ahead as it moves faster than Object B.
From t1 to t2, Object B accelerates and matches velocity of A at t2.
Maximum separation occurs when area difference is greatest, just before t2.
Objects are farthest apart at t1 when Object B is slowest and A has most distance.
Final answer: Objects are farthest apart at time t1.
